As an AI language model, I am not able to connect you with a professor directly to participate in a research project or community outreach program at Marquette University. It's important to understand that these programs require effort, dedication, and commitment from participants. Seeking such opportunities is an excellent way to gain knowledge, develop skills, and make valuable connections within your field of interest. 

You can explore the Marquette University website, talk to academic advisors, professors within your department, and student organizations that specialize in research and community outreach programs to access such opportunities. You could also check the bulletin boards around campus for information about such projects. Additionally, you might want to consider volunteering within your community or joining student clubs based on your areas of interest. Doing so can provide you with valuable experience and may enhance your chances of participating in research projects or community outreach programs later on.
